originalText.text: This is a nice bar in the area and they have a good happy hour. The oysters were quite fresh. We were happier I would say the downfall is they only offer wine flights instead of glasses of wine so youâ€™re kind of forced to try three wines you might not like which actually have Boss. They have some nice outdoor seating and some indoor city. I did not get to check out the garden part. We also tried another appetizer, which just was not great. I think that the appetizers on their happy hour is not our favorite. We didnâ€™t eat dinner here but I would try it in the future potentially. I just wish they had a better robust happy hour menu.plus the atmosphere was just OK. It was really quiet. We were like the only people there, which is not the most exciting thing for New York but I would definitely try to get maybe when itâ€™s a little busier.

originalText.text: What a treat for Friday night! The food was so yummy. I highly recommend the salmon, shrimp tacos and the croquette jamÃ³n. Also I liked more the chicken empanadas than the steak. Both delicious! They have a diverse wine selection. I drunk the Chardonnay all night and it was perfect! My friend had cocktails and it was good too. The ambience is so cute and restrooms are really clean.

originalText.text:
Aunt Bernies is a very fun & lively place. We chose to sit outside in their beautiful outdoor dining area, which had lots of space for big groups.

Food was great and reasonably priced. The menu had a nice selection of tapas, which made it easy to pick out a few things for the table to share.  The drink menu was also interesting, and not filled with typical big name brands, but more of the unique choices, you can tell they put great effort in choosing each item.  I was in the mood for a refreshing crisp beer and the server recommended a really good beer from Spain.  I noticed the table next to me were enjoying wine flights.

I did peak inside, great atmosphere, beautiful bar with dim lighting and very fun vibe. The interior seems great for the evening and theres a beautiful indoor garden room in the back for parties and private events.

I have to say that Iâ€™m very impressed with the Aunt Bernies team, they are for sure elevating Murray Hill area!

originalText.text:
Excellent happy hour! Various wine flights for $13 (normally $18), dozen oysters for $15 (normally $36), and various apps on discount.

The baked brie puff is so yummy! The other apps are solid too, but the French onion soup was very disappointing.
